result.execSummary:
The defendant Matthew D. McClure was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: PAID IN FULL FROM BOND ON DEPOSIT.

Attorney Dan Tombasco appeared for the State.  Defendant appeared in court in person and w/ Attorney S. Johnson.  Clerk. M.Burke.   State in victim rights compliance. On states motion count 1 is dismissed and read in. DE pleads guilty to count 2. Court finds DE guilty on count 2. Court imposes a sentence of 7 days jail; credit for 1 day served. Costs imposed. DE to report to jail on 8/13/22 at 8:00am. DE to pay $100 DV surcharge. DE to submit DNA sample and pay $200 DNA surcharge. Bond applied, any remainder to be returned to poster.

Based on unavailability of defense counsel on 7/20 due to mandatory training, FPT removed from court's calendar.  JS date of 8/8 changed to a FPT - time remains the same.  Confirming email sent to attys
from the court re: Judicial Rotation
No disposition. Leave on for next scheduled court activity.

Pre-trial conference on June 3, 2022 at 01:15 pm.
Final pre-trial on July 20, 2022 at 09:40 am.
Jury selection on August 8, 2022 at 09:00 am.

01:06 PM 
  Attorney Andrew Burgoyne appeared for the State.  Defendant appeared in court in person and w/ Attorney Seth Johnson.  Clerk JT  Minutes:  The Court finds probable cause in this case today.  Plea of Not Guilty entered.   Pre-trial conference scheduled for June 3, 2022 at 01:15 pm.  Final pre-trial scheduled for July 20, 2022 at 09:40 am.  Jury selection scheduled for August 8, 2022 at 09:00 am.  Bond is continued.    jk

Minutes:  Clerk/T. Lema.  ADA Alex Huber appeared for the State.  Deft appeared along w/Atty Seth Johnson.  Competency report has been received which opines the deft is now competent to proceed.  State concurs with the findings.  Deft and defense counsel concur with the findings.  Court finds the deft is competent to proceed.  Case remanded back to intake court for initial appearance on 5/4/22 @ 1pm.
